alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 8:57PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Phillips, southwestern Phelps, southeastern Gosper, Furnas and Harlan Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 855 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Bertrand to near Hendley to 8 miles south of Danbury. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar and mesonet observations. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hendley around 900 PM CDT. Oxford and Atlanta around 915 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Orleans, Huntley, Alma and Prairie View. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Harlan County Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
